content.rendered:
About This Service

FindTreatment.gov is the most comprehensive resource for persons seeking treatment for mental health and substance abuse in the United States and its territories. You can search for treatment facilities, health care centers, buprenorphine practitioners, and opioid treatment providers.

About the Provider

The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) is the Federal agency dedicated to mental health and substance abuse. SAMHSA is part of the Department of Health and Human Services.

FindTreatment.gov is authorized by the 21st Century Cures Act.

Other Info

For telephone based supports call 1-800-662-4357 (HELP); 1-800-487-4889 (TTY)

excerpt.rendered: Treatment provider search tool operated by SAMHSA, a US Federal agency.
